theoryTitle: Crocodile's Master Plan Extends Beyond Alabasta
theoryText: The meticulous nature of Crocodile's trap in Episode 105 suggests his plans extend far beyond simply conquering Alabasta. His calm confidence when learning the Straw Hats have arrived, combined with his control over the city's prosperity during a kingdom-wide drought, indicates he's been orchestrating events for years. This level of planning might be connected to his search for the ancient weapon Pluton.
author: Various One Piece community members
resolution: Later confirmed that Crocodile was indeed searching for Pluton and had been planning for years.

theoryTitle: Smoker's Independent Investigation Foreshadows Marine Corruption
theoryText: Smoker's presence in Rainbase investigating Crocodile independently, despite Crocodile being a government-sanctioned Warlord, suggests early awareness of corruption and flaws in the World Government's system. His willingness to pursue a Warlord shows his dedication to true justice over bureaucratic politics.
author: One Piece community analysis
resolution: Smoker's character consistently demonstrates independence from corrupt Marine leadership throughout the series.

theoryText: In Episode 105, Miss All Sunday (Nico Robin) assists Crocodile in preparing the trap for the Straw Hats, but her eventual betrayal of Baroque Works and joining the Straw Hat crew suggests she may have had ulterior motives even during this episode. Her calm demeanor might hide her own agenda regarding the Poneglyphs and ancient history.
author: One Piece community retrospective analysis
resolution: Robin was using Baroque Works to search for Poneglyphs and eventually betrayed Crocodile to join the Straw Hats.
